availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philos Stratton (Madison County, Kentucky artist and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky artist and soldier. Vermont native. Married to Eliza Boswell Stratton in Preble County, Ohio on October 12, 1856. Artist in Madison County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 49th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant Colonel from June 20, 1863 and mustered out on September 23, 1863 for promotion to Major. Served in the 49th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Major from September 23, 1863 to December 22, 1863. Served in the 49th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant Colonel from December 23, 1863 to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 420.
Ohio County Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Ohio, Preble County Marriages, Film #000564963, p. 470.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 451.
Find A Grave, "Col. Philos Stratton (Nov 5, 1826-Dec 14, 1878)," Memorial #73746551, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73746551 (accessed June 22, 2020).
